problem_text:
Is the lattice of formations of finite nilpotent groups of class ⩽ 4 distributive?

A. N. Skiba
answer: No. The lattice L of all varieties of nilpotent 2-groups of class ⩽ 4 is non-distributive (Yu. A. Belov, Algebra and Logic, 9, no. 6 (1970), 371-374; R. A. Bryce, Philos. Trans. Roy. Soc. London (A), 266 (1970), 281–355, footnote on p. 335). The mapping V → V ∩ F, where F is the class of all finite groups, is an embedding of L into the lattice of formations. (L. Kov´acs, Letter of May, 12, 1988.) See also (L. A. Shemetkov, A. N. Skiba, Formations of algebraic systems, Nauka, Moscow, 1989 (Russian)).
